answers.answer: Are you still experiencing symptoms?  Do you mean by "chest fluttering" that you feel something (your heart) fluttering inside your chest?If symptoms continue I'd suggest seeing a doctor, and going to ER if you get pains in the chest and/or arm.  Angina is another name for heart attack, I believe, which should be checked to be sure.

question: I am a 48 yr old female diagnosed with diabetes type 2 on 7/16/08, I am on oral medications.  I was sitting on my bed playing my game when I felt my chest flutter 3 times, when it first happened I thought I was going to throw up and I got light headed.  As fast as it came, it went away, I was just puzzled as to what could have made that happen?  I didnt do any excertive exercises today prior to that happening so it just kinda took me by surprise. There was no sweating, chest or anything radiating down my left side.  Could you please give me a clue as to what it could be? My husband says it sounds like Angina. I have been short breathed for a couple of days.Thank You
title: Chest Fluttering
